item.title: Gibraltar bourse adds bitcoin-centric Exchange Traded Instrument
item.description:
Gibraltar bourse adds bitcoin-centric Exchange Traded Instrument

Heads up digital currency fans: Europe now have a regulated product for cryptocurrency. The Gibraltar Stock Exchange announced on Monday that it has added BitcoinETI, an asset-backed Exchange Traded Instrument that exclusively invested in bitcoin-making it the first European regulated product for digital currency.

item.title: New Federal Reserve Interest Hike Will Not Improve Its Credibility
item.description:
New Federal Reserve Interest Hike Will Not Improve Its Credibility

A lot of people have been keeping their eye on the Federal Reserve. Later this week, the US central bank will decide whether or not further interest hikes are scheduled for 2016. Not too long ago, it seemed unlikely this would happen, but the situation has changed again.

item.title: The Munich Killer's Weapon Bought for Bitcoins Was a Theatrical Prop
item.description:
The Munich Killer's Weapon Bought for Bitcoins Was a Theatrical Prop

Last week, the world's media was full of terrible news on a shootdown in a mall in the German city of Munich committed by a man of Iranian descent. According to Suddeutsche Zeitung, the gun that the killer bought on the dark web, was initially a replica.

item.title: What are the limits on buying bitcoin in China?
item.description:
What are the limits on buying bitcoin in China?

Are their limits that exchanges impose on buying bitcoin in China? Or on withdrawing bitcoin from those exchanges? For example can one buy $100,000USD of bitcoin over the course of several months, without any concern?

item.title: Who controls Bitcoin?
item.description:
Who controls Bitcoin?

Here's the Bitcoin source code - bitcoin/bitcoin - it says there are 376 contributors, which you can see here - contributors. Bitcoin miners, the people that make transactions permanent, are everywhere where there's cheap electricity (mostly China and places with geothermal/hydro plants).

item.title: Ernst & Young Blockchain Startup Challenge: send your idea | HolyTransaction
item.description:
Ernst & Young Blockchain Startup Challenge: send your idea | HolyTransaction

The well-known company Ernst & Young revealed a new startup contest held in London, to "explore how blockchain technology can tackle challenges in digital rights management and energy trading."

item.title: Florida Judge Defines Bitcoin As Property Rather Than Money
item.description:
Florida Judge Defines Bitcoin As Property Rather Than Money

Depending on how one wants to look at the situation, the judge ruling Bitcoin isn't money is both good and bad at the same time. The judge ruled Bitcoin to be property, which may very well set a precedent for future Bitcoin-related court cases.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Today's Scalp Strategy - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Today's Scalp Strategy - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this morning. It's Tuesday morning out of Europe, and time to take our first look of the day at the bitcoin price.

item.title: Bright Future for Bitcoin After Florida Case Dismissal
item.description:
Bright Future for Bitcoin After Florida Case Dismissal

A Florida judge has dismissed long-standing charges against Michel Espinoza, accused since 2014 of illegal money transmission and money laundering for selling bitcoin. Also read: Gibraltar Lands First European Bitcoin ETI The case and decision are now likely to have widespread positive implications for Bitcoin in the South Florida region, said the defense's main expert witness.

item.title: Roger Ver Challenges Bernie Sanders Again, Raises Offer to $250K
item.description:
Roger Ver Challenges Bernie Sanders Again, Raises Offer to $250K

Back in March Bitcoin.com Also read: Enemies Of The Sharing Economy reported on investor Roger Ver challenging the Vermont senator, Bernie Sanders to debate with Adam Kokesh. Ver had offered $100,000 to get Sanders to discuss Socialism Vs. Libertarianism with the Iraq war combat veteran turned peace activist.
